mcm.graphics
Class Shape

java.lang.Object
  mcm.graphics.Shape
Direct Known Subclasses:
ImageShape, SizedShape, TextShape
public class Shape
extends java.lang.Object

Shape is the base class of all shapes used in mcm.graphics. They can be painted to Graphics contexts. Body objects use shapes to draw themselves at their current positions.

Shapes have a width, height, color, line width, and hotSpot mode attribute. Derived shapes are expected to be drawn within the rectangle defined by their width and height.

Shape's have two drawing methods: paint and draw. A shape's paint method draws its shape such that the lower left corner of its drawing rectangle lies at the origin of the coordinate system defined by the graphics context to which it is drawn. A shape's draw method draws its shape such that its hot spot point appears at the origin of the coordinate system. Derived shapes need to implement their own paint methods. They are expected to paint such that the lower left corner appears at (0,0) and the upper right corner at (getWidth(), getHeight()), and the shape's drawing stays within the rectangular area defined by these two points.

A shape's hot spot point is updated according to its width, height, and hot spot mode, whenever any of these are changed. If a shape's hotSpot mode, for example, equals CENTER its hot spot point is kept at the point (getWidth()/2, geteEight()/2). If its mode equals LOWER_LEFT or UPPER_RIGHT) its hot spot point is set to (0,0) or (getWidth(), getHeight()) respectively, see setHotSpot(int)and setHotSpotPoint(Point).

Constructor Detail

Shape

protected Shape()
Constructs a new shape object. It has an undefined hotSpotMode and zero width and height

Shape

protected Shape(double width,
                double height,
                int alignment)
Constructs a newly shape object. Its color is set to a slightly transparent red amd its lineWidth is 1.

Parameters:
width - the new shape's width in pixels
height - the new shape's height in pixels
alignment - the new shape's alignment

Parameters:
mode - a hotSpot mode

contains

public boolean contains(double x,
                        double y)
Checks whether (x,y) lies in the interior of this shape. The (x,y) coordinates are intepreted relative to the shape's hot spot. The shape is assumed to cover a rectangular area defined by the lower left point (-hostSpot.x, -hotSpot.y) and the shape's width and height.

Parameters:
x - x coordinate
y - y coordinate
Returns:
true if (x,y) lies within the shape's area, false otherwise

getShape

protected java.awt.Shape getShape()
Retunrs a Rectangle2D.Double shape describing this shape's drawing area. The rectagle shape is defined by the lower left corner (-hotspot.x, -hotSpot.y) and the shape's width and height. Derived classes should overwrite this method to return more suitable awtShapes.

y - y coordinate of point
gr - the graphics context to draw to

getPos

public Point getPos(int alignment,
                    Point global)
Returns the coordinates of the point at the given alignment position relative to this shape's hotSpot. The alignment value indicates which point's coordinates are requested. Returns the computed coordinates in global if non null or in a newly allocated point.

Parameters:
alignment - all alignment values, except FIXED_POINT
global - null or reference to a point
Returns:
global, if not null, or newly allocated point

paint

public void paint(java.awt.Graphics2D g2D)
Paints this shape to the given graphics context. This implementation of paint simply draws a frame around the shape's drawing area. Derived classes must implement this method, such that the shape is painted to the given graphics context in a way that (0,0) coincides with the lower left of the shape's drawing.

Parameters:
g2D - the graphics context to draw to

setColor

public void setColor(java.awt.Color color)
Sets the shape's color.

Parameters:
color - the new color

setDebug

public void setDebug(boolean debug)
Sets the shape's debug mode. Shapes draw a rectangle around their drawing area when debug is set to true.

Parameters:
debug - debug mode

setHeight

public void setHeight(double height)
Sets the shape's height in pixels; height must be greater than 0. The same as calling setSize(getWidth(), height).

Parameters:
height - the new width; must be greater zero

setHotSpot

public void setHotSpot(int mode)
Sets the shape's hotSpot mode.

A shape's hotSpot mode determines how its lower left corner is positioned relative to a given paint position. A shape's hotSpot mode determines the value of a shape's hotSpot point which is adjusted whenever ths shape's size is changed.

The available modes are:

CENTER
put the shape's center at the paint position
UPPER_LEFT
put the shape's upper left corner at the paint position
UPPER_RIGHT
put the shape's upper right corner at the paint position
LOWER_LEFT
put the shape's lower left corner at the paint position
LOWER_RIGHT
put the shape's lower right corner at the paint position
LOWER_CENTER
put the shape's midpoint on its lower side at the paint position
UPPER_CENTER
put the shape's midpoint on its upper side at the paint position
MIDDLE_LEFT
put the shape's midpoint on its left side at the paint position
MIDDLE_RIGHT
put the shape's midpoint on its right side at the paint position
FIXED_POINT
put the shape's hotSpot at the paint position.

Parameters:
mode - the new hotSpot mode

setHotSpotPoint

public void setHotSpotPoint(Point hotSpotPoint)
Sets the shape's hotSpot point to the given point and its hotSpot mode to FIXED_POINT. When this shape is resized it's hotSpot point is not adjusted.

Parameters:
hotSpotPoint - the new hotSpot to set.

setLineWidth

public void setLineWidth(int lineWidth)
Sets the shape's line width.

Parameters:
lineWidth - the new width

setSize

public void setSize(double width,
                    double height)
Sets the new dimension to be width and height measured in pixels. Adjusts the hotSpot point as necessary. The hotSpot point remains unchanged if the hotSpot mode equals FIXED_POINT.

Parameters:
width - new width; must be greater zero
height - new height; must be greater zero

setWidth

public void setWidth(double width)
Sets the shape's width in pixels; width must be greater than 0. The same as calling setSize(width, getHeight()).

Parameters:
width - the new width; must be greater zero

toString

public java.lang.String toString()
Returns a string representation of this shape. The string constists of the shape's unqualified class name followed by its current width and height and hotSpot information.

Overrides:
toString in class java.lang.Object
